attributes.additional_details:
This Petition is different from previous examples calling for a General Election which were critical of the Government or its Members.

On the 4th September 2019, Parliament passed a bill excluding the possibility of no-deal. The Government’s negotiating position has been significantly weakened.

With no working majority, the Government is rendered impotent by opposition MPs and Tory rebels. A General Election is now the only way that the public can elect a majority Government to deliver Brexit.
attributes.background:
The government has lost its majority and its ability to leave the EU “with or without a deal” as mandated by the people in the 2016 EU Referendum.

We demand that in the present circumstances, Parliament holds a General Election without delay in accordance with the Fixed Term Parliaments Act 2011.

rejection.details:
When we consider duplicate petitions, we look at the actions being requested. In this case, we think this petition is similar:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/264215
